Award.AwardTitle: Graduate Student Conference in Algebra, Geometry, and Topology
Award.AbstractNarration:
This award supports participation in the third Temple University Graduate Student Conference in Algebra, Geometry, and Topology, taking place in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, on June 3-4, 2017. This conference will involve more than 90 graduate students from the East Coast and beyond, with a variety of backgrounds and research levels. The conference provides an opportunity for graduate students to develop their academic careers at an early stage by presenting mathematics in front of their peers. With thirty graduate student talks on a wide range of topics and a diversity of research interests among the plenary speakers, the conference also provides opportunities for graduate students to learn about areas of mathematical research that are not prevalent at their home universities. The conference provides unique opportunities for young mathematicians to initiate collaborative research projects and to make connections between their fields of study.

The main topics of this conference are algebra, geometry, and topology broadly construed, with emphasis on interactions between these areas, including: knot theory, geometric group theory, geometric structures on manifolds, differential geometry, homotopy theory, representation theory, homological algebra, quantum invariants of manifolds, quantum groups, and algebraic geometry. The conference will feature over thirty talks by graduate students, both original research talks and expository presentations. It will also include four plenary speakers renowned for both their presentation skills and research work: Renato Bettiol (University of Pennsylvania) in differential geometry, Spencer Dowdall (Vanderbilt University) in low-dimensional topology and group theory, Holly Krieger (University of Cambridge) in arithmetic and algebra of complex dynamical systems, and Emily Peters (Loyola University Chicago) in operator algebras.

Web site: https://math.temple.edu/events/conferences/gscagt

POR.DRECONTENT:
The Temple University Graduate Student Conference in Algebra, Geometry, & Topology took place in Philadelphia on June 3-4, 2017. The conference brought together over 100 graduate students from a variety of backgrounds and universities, along with 4 distinguished plenary speakers from these fields of study. The main purpose of this conference was to bring young mathematicians with similar research interests together to develop mathematical relationships through  presenting their work, discussing ideas and asking questions after talks and during social events, and interacting with the plenary speakers.

The majority of talks, thirty-three in total, were given by graduate student participants, supplying them with opportunities to practice presenting their research ideas and interests to a supportive audience of their fellow students. The conference aimed for diversity of topics, participants, and speakers, including under-represented minorities in the field, both as participants and speakers. In addition, talks by distinguished plenary speakers provided insights into how different parts of algebra, geometry, and topology are connected, highlight open research questions of interest, and promoted recent techniques used in groundbreaking work in these fields. Moreover, the organizing committe consists of two faculty advisors and a panel of graduate students, affording them many professional development opportunities.

This grant supported travel and housing expenses for participating graduate students and plenary speakers, facilities rental expenses, and the cost of refreshments for coffee breaks structured in order to stimulate discussion between small groups of participants and between participants and plenary speakers. The overwhelming majority of the funding went towards the travel expenses of graduate students.
